website_summaries.verdict: A great adjustable kickstand for smaller bikes that holds up well over time and won't get in your way while you ride.
pros: Won't interfere with the pedals or disc brakes
Spring action makes it easy to raise and lower
cons: On certain bike frames, it can be difficult to securely tighten this kickstand

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality manfacturing
customer_reviews.text: The threaded holes for the mounting bolts are misalligned and are not cut cleanly. I was barely able to unscrew the bolts and noticed metal shavings in the body of the bracket. Poor quality materials of construction combined with inferior manufacturing/tooling makes for a defective product. Do not buy. I have requested a return and am awaiting a response from the seller. One of the seven Continents on Earth where this product was produced choose to make things inexpensively, but forgo quality in the process. I would be willing to pay a fair price for a quality product. Unfortunately there are few, if any, North American vendors remaining in the manufacturing business.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Millhouse

customer_reviews.title: Perfect On My GT Aggressor Pro Mountain Bike
customer_reviews.text: 1) Easy To Install. 2) Easy To Adjust. 3) Fits My GT Aggressor Pro. 4) Durable. I Kicked The Kickstand As Hard As I Could With The Side, Back, & Front Of Both Of My Shoes; It Stayed In Place Without Moving. I Bounced The Back Of My Bike As Hard As I Could Multiple Times; It Stayed In Place Without Moving. I Hit The Kickstand As Hard As I Could With A Hammer; It Stayed In Place Without Moving.
customer_reviews.author: Proud American Nationalist

customer_reviews.title: Great Kickstand.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a few of these for our fleet of bikes. It works perfectly for my daughter's Novara Laurel, which couldn't accept a traditional kickstand. It's bigger than you'd think. I do like how it doesn't interfere with spinning the crank (easy chain lubing), or the disk brake. Adjustable length is a great feature. Only caution is to make sure your Chain-stay Tube is sufficiently oval, or it will rotate. Most newer aluminum frames won't be a problem, but my old Diamondback WCF with a small and rounder steel chain-stay doesn't work well.
customer_reviews.author: TMC

customer_reviews.title: Just Buy It
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for my Diamondback Trace Comp bike - it was recommended by DB customer service and is the only one that will fit since the derailleur cable routes behind the crank (where most kickstands mount) and the disc brakes. Easy to install. High quality product. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: cbHoo

customer_reviews.title: Fits nicely
customer_reviews.text: This kickstand works great. I have a Diamondback Women's clarity bike and it fits on perfectly. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the color is slightly different in person. The online picture shows the little sticker as being a blue/teal color, which was perfect because it matched the colors on my bike perfectly. However, when the product came in the sticker was actually red. It is a very minor difference so I chose to keep it. Overall I am happy with the product and its quality
customer_reviews.author: Emily Davis

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my Haro Hybrid bike.
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed with the quality and installation. It easily supports my bike and the installation doesn't mar the new bike's paint. I appreciated that. The only issue for some might be that this type of side mount kickstand can sometimes hit the back of you heel when you pedal but I was able to reposition it as far back as I could so no problem now. But if the bike were smaller, and the distance from the rear hub and the pedals a little shorter, I would have to send it back. But in my instance it works perfectly. I don't think this is a fault with this stand but I imagine all side mount kickstands.
customer_reviews.author: MaxwellJ

customer_reviews.title: Fairly good quality and stability
customer_reviews.text: I installed it on my Fuji road bike and I had to move it all the way back close to the axle toward my rear wheel because my shoe was hitting it. It is not very sturdy where it mounts to the bike. Even after I tightened the 3 screws I could twist the whole thing not much but enough to drive me crazy :) Bottom line it works! and no regrets for price I paid for this kickstand. Btw, I still use my folding bike stand when I store my bike in the garage but use the kickstand when I am out biking.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Loosens after use. You will have to replace it eventually.
customer_reviews.text: Product does not work. I’ve had to tighten this kick stand every few days after my daughters uses her bike. It inevitably gets loose. And today, it’s now at the point where the screws are so used it will no longer tighten. So I now have to buy a new kick stand. Rate zero if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Solid kickstand, but watch that rubber when installing
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 for my kids' bikes. First one was very easy and stays tight. Second one came loose and I had to reinstall it. There is a rubber gasket piece to prevent damage to the bike metal. On my second, the rubber slid forward and the kickstand piece scratched my bike frame pretty bad. I was able to cover it back up when I reinstalled the kickstand, but now my frame is scratched up and I have to watch for rust..... Watch that gasket when tightening down the screws!
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: By mounting if far back on the left side behind the disk brake I was able to adjust it perfectly and now have a great kick stand
customer_reviews.text: I tried these after the Trek dealer said there was no kick stand made for my 29 inch Excalibur 9. By mounting if far back on the left side behind the disk brake I was able to adjust it perfectly and now have a great kick stand. The Trek dealer said he thought it would fall when riding and recommended I just lean the back wheel on a tree or something. No exactly how I wanted to treat a thousand dollar bike this works a whole lot better. the quality is good, it takes a bit of back and forth tightening the screws to get it snug and even. I also check it and all the screws regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Always Buying Something

customer_reviews.title: Your bike will fall over, poorly made.
customer_reviews.text: This kick stand is awful. We bought 2 different ones here on Amazon. This brand and another. This one is awful. It won’t stay locked on the bar no matter how tight you make the screws. It just ends up rolling over, resulting in a bike laying on the ground. This is the second Amazon recommended product I’ve gotten that’s been shockingly poor in quality. The other kick stand we purchased is much more stable so I’m confident this particular brand is the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfection - even for an old 1969 Raleigh Bike
customer_reviews.text: I got this kickstand for an old 1969 Raleigh bike. My bike has rounded piping instead of the oval-shaped piping that this product is supposed to fit, but it wasn't a problem. I wrapped my bike's frame with a bit of electrical tape for added grip, but it wasn't needed. The length of the stand is adjustable, so it works for large- or small-framed bikes. Nice to see something that does what it says it will do ... and more. Very pleased!!
customer_reviews.author: Knettie

customer_reviews.title: Works well on my folding bike.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a well-made device. By cutting off some of the extendable stem and trimming off the top of the rubber foot, I was able to make it work on my folding bike with 16" wheels. (It's too long otherwise for this size wheels.) When tightening the 3 attachment bolts you have to make sure you don't strip the aluminum threads in the casting. No parts that can rust, so that's good. Bike designers should realize people need kickstands.
customer_reviews.author: D. Payne

customer_reviews.title: Great kickstand
customer_reviews.text: I was frustrated how my new bike came without a kickstand, but I put this one on another bike I bought a while back, so I figured, let's do it again. This time, I got the black one, to match the bike. I really love these. They are affordable, and easy to install, they work great, and I'm so happy to have it on my bike. It's just about perfect, just make sure you get it set up right, so your bike will lean the exact right amount and doesn't tip over.
customer_reviews.author: Rejean Durette

customer_reviews.title: Too bulky and not tight on bike
customer_reviews.text: This kickstand I’ve had for 2 years, it is bulky and mounts to the frame of the bike (not ideal), it would get in the way of the tire when in certain positions and was hard to get it to remain tight the whole time. It was ok. But I recently bought a different kick stand for the same 16” wheel bike (my daughters). One that mounts to the bolt that holds the back wheel in place. Less bulky and more sturdy and it doesn’t interfere with the tire rotations.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Monaco

customer_reviews.title: Good Kickstand at a Decent Price
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I had to put my bike on a rack to adjust the Kickstand. It needs to have clearance between the pedals and brake disk on the wheel. If you do not have disk brakes installation is much easier. I will buy another for a second bike now that I know the quality is good And the fit is right. The padding is good where it clamps so the frame doesn’t get scratched up.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny D

customer_reviews.title: Good solid kickstand
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kickstand for my road bike because I hate having to lean my bike on something, especially not on the ground. Once installed, kickstand is very sturdy and stable. It also looks very nice. The only issue with this stand is it's a bit bulky. Because it has to be mounted to the left side of the wheel frame, it sticks out which causes your left heel come into contact with it. So everytime you pedal, your left heel rubs it making it a little annoying. Overall, item works the way it should, just got to make small adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: K-Trek

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install & Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, did not have to make any adjustments even though it’s adjustable for length. Using on my new Villano Roadbike. I had to adjust the location on the chainstay bar so the crank arm didn’t rub against it which was not a problem. Very well made, looks attractive but not light weight. If your a “gram nut counter” you won’t want this. I ride for pleasure - not for speed. I’d buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Roger C.

customer_reviews.title: VERY Nice Kickstands - HIDDEN PRICE-JACK
customer_reviews.text: These are VERY Nice Kickstands! Punctual delivery, very well packaged, easy install, works well, looks great. Purchas price was the driver on this. Hidden Delivery Price nearly caused package return... SELLER PRICE-JACKED ME TO THE HILT !!! $3 per unit bait price with $8 per unit added to my card... Theses were priced so low that I ordered 6 (six) units to replace the stands on all my bikes and have a couple spares. $48 delivery on an $18 box ?!?
customer_reviews.author: Ronald M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my 19" Specialized Hardrock hybrid with 26" tires
customer_reviews.text: I believe this kickstand (TOPCABIN Bike Kickstand Adjustable Aluminium Alloy) is made for 22-26" mountain bikes, but I took a chance using it on my 19" frame (26" wheels) Specialized Hardrock hybrid, and it works great. The original kickstand I was given with this bike (bought it used) was total junk, and literally began falling off the bike after using it once or twice. I was seriously a safety hazard. This one (TOPCABIN) from Amazon is easy to install, and so far, after a hard 16-mile ride with plenty of bumps and shakes, it has remained solid and strong. It's still early (only had it one day), but so far this seems like a viable kickstand.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: What you'd expect for price
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be made out of soft pot metal or similer quality metal. Won't hold up to any abuse. The bolts are also low quality metal and one broke off while assembling without much force at all. I fixed it by drilling it out and using another bolt/nut I had in my toolbox. That all said its what I expected for price and will do the job. Holds up my heavy fat tire ebike just fine.
customer_reviews.author: LovesAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Great bike kickstand
customer_reviews.text: I never understand why some bikes don't come with kickstand; I think it is done for profit reason. Anyhow, my new bike is one of those; I like everything else of this bike enough to overlook this negative. This kickstand came a few days ago and took me may be 10 minutes to install it. Very good looking and performed well so far. I have no concerns at this time.
customer_reviews.author: PhotographerTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Death Trap
customer_reviews.text: I was able to test these on a fixie. It seemed to work ok initially. Then I let someone use the bike for a ride together. They almost flipped the bike with the kick stand flipping out mid-ride. It was placed on the bottom rear of the frame and was beyond the peddles' reach, just as in the listing's picture. So naturally, I haven't used it since.
customer_reviews.author: FurryFriend

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my wife’s hybrid bike over a month ago. It works well, looks good, very lightweight and seems sturdy. Although it’s easy to install - I came with a rubber insert that allowed me to install it on a bar that not square like the clamps, it’s a bid oval. A word of caution, you got to tight the adjustable nut and the clamp bolts very tightly, and do it evenly. I had to fully extend the leg, I was worried that it was not long enough. My wife’s bike has 26” wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Javman

customer_reviews.title: Maybe not for heavier or loaded bikes
customer_reviews.text: Overall it didnt work for my road touring bike. I should have initially gotten a dual kickstand but it is what it is. The stand would probably work better for mountain bikes or those without too much load. I didnt realize my bike already had a mounting plate up front and decided to try this. It just didnt work for me the bracket would slide out when the bike was parked and it would fall over. I put it to the tightest setting and still it slid out. Just didnt work for my needs but maybe it will for you
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: which means it works best if you have an oval-shaped chain stay tube to ...
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for. I originally bought a different one only to discover it was not compatible with disc brakes. This stand has an oval-shaped clamp, which means it works best if you have an oval-shaped chain stay tube to clamp it to. Otherwise, it might spin. Luckily, my tube is oval and it clamps on nicely. The stand stows conveniently toward the rear of the bike and out of the way, with no chance of hitting it with your heel. It also has a sturdy rubber foot to keep from scratching floors and other surfaces (as well as being more grippy). For the money, I don't think I could have done better than this!
customer_reviews.author: Robert V. L. Johnstone

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike Stand but
customer_reviews.text: Would have given this a five but for the rubber bushing that fit around the stand and the bike. The rubber bushing does not create enough friction to keep the bike stand from twisting on the bike frame. I replaced the rubber with a piece of an old nyon belt. The nylon worked great and the kick stand no longer twist. Other than that it's a great bike stand.
customer_reviews.author: ceemoss

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work on my Cannondale
customer_reviews.text: I had to return it. So disappointed. No matter how tight my husband and I tightened it (we are strong people - we are competitive powerlifters), it would always loosen on its own. It even almost caused me to wreck as it loosened and then slipped into my wheel spoke! Great idea, but unfortunately that’s where it ended.
customer_reviews.author: Kwana C. Jones-becker

customer_reviews.title: Bad experience... Tested on multiple bikes
customer_reviews.text: I have a higher-end bike that didn't come with a kickstand and I thought this one would work perfectly unfortunately no matter how I mounted it the kickstand would not hold the bike. I can't say that I recommended I also tried it on the second cheaper bike and while it worked it wasn't very stable they're better kickstands on Amazon for a similar price I would go with one of those.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: My son's new 24" bike came without a kickstand. Looked at a couple options and ordered this one figuring that it was low cost and would be easy to return if it didn't fit. However, it fit perfectly! I placed it on the bar behind the pedal. It doesn't move around - very sturdy. It holds the bike up well. And it folds nicely out if the way.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn J.

customer_reviews.title: Kickstand
customer_reviews.text: The Kickstand works perfect if one does one thing before tightening down screws : Make sure the Kickstand doesn't interfere with the rotation of the pedal on the Kickstand Side. That's why I gave it a Medium score on 'Ease of Install' . .
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Beamish

customer_reviews.title: So easy to install, perfect fit for a mountain bike!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install. Four allen wrench screws. Everything was included. Took 5 mins top to install. Works perfect, as I wanted a rear mounting kickstand. I had bought another one before this, but it didn't fit right. This one, I'm sure can fit mostly any bike. Looks wonderful with my new mountain bike!
customer_reviews.author: kdat33

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal for kids bikes but will work
customer_reviews.text: Not ideal for kids bikes but it will work. I put it on my son’s 24” bike. The kickstand basically clamps onto the frame. My son’s bike was too narrow back at the real wheel so I had to slide the kickstand forward to fit properly. It sits just far enough back to be clear of the pedals. I’d prefer it farther back and out it the way.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: The Top Cabin kickstand does not hold the bike in an upright position!
customer_reviews.text: This top cabin bike kickstand is virtually useless! I tried to install it on two different bikes, one with a circular frame and the other with an oblong frame, and in either case no matter how tight I tightened the screws, did the kickstand support either bike. I tried to thicken each frame With hockey tape and the kickstand still slid sideways and both bikes fell down. I am not sure what kind of bike is kickstand would work on. I am going to try to find a kickstand with a two point support to avoid the serious problem that this kickstand has. I am very disappointed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Janes

customer_reviews.title: it works!
customer_reviews.text: it installed easy, extended the adjustable foot, and it holds my beauty up perfectly. black matches the paint job and me and my bike are happy campers! who cares what anyone else thinks about kick stands, everyone has their opinion, just like... well, you know. it keeps my bike up and that's all that matters to me. Merry Christmas!
customer_reviews.author: hawaiiguy808

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: After dealing with a low-end, non-adjustable kick stand that never really worked for 3 years, I finally bought one that had height adjustments and wish I'd have bought it much sooner. This allows you to install it and get just the right amount of "lean" in your bike when it's parked. It does not interfere with the pedals or with pedaling. It's a good all-around kick stand.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Mom

customer_reviews.title: Several issues
customer_reviews.text: The only good thing I liked about this was how smooth it was to kick up and down, but it did not work for my bike. The way the stand is angled out at the joint made my pedal hit it and not go past no matter where I placed on the bar. The padding that sits in the bar is also not attached so while trying to hold all the pieces together to screw it together the padding kept falling out. The holes were also not aligned properly as someone mentioned in another review which left metal shavings. Would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Almost 5 stars...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assembly. Seems to work fine after installing it. Long term reliability to be determined. Did not include hex wrench tool to tighten the bolt that installs onto the bike. It only included the hex wrench to adjust the length of the stand. Hence a 1-star reduction.
customer_reviews.author: AlvinNTX

customer_reviews.title: Kickstand actually stands up the bike
customer_reviews.text: Do you have a bike that is always falling over because of the under-designed kickstand that came with it. My wife did. That bike would just end up laying on the ground. The Top Cabin kickstand was very easy to install and adjust and now the bike stands up every time. Imagine that.
customer_reviews.author: DRM

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and quite sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.text: It fit my 30 year old LL Bean (Cannondale) mountain bike just fine. The tube is about 1.25 inches in diameter. Holds the bike well and clears the pedal. I never had a stand on it before. Decided to add one this year before giving the bike to my grandson. This is a fine product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't work as described. The liner that is suppose to grip on your bike's frame doesn't work well and the stand slowly leans in and eventually falls. Tightening the screws results in the screw head snapping off. Even with a stronger replacement screw, the stand doesn't grip to the frame.
customer_reviews.author: SoBayCPA

customer_reviews.title: Best adjustable kickstand for your mountain bike!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for my bike and the wife's....most mountain bikes do not come with kickstands (a real pain) but the thinking is your off roading and the kickstand can pop open getting in the way. I just live in the country and don't do hardcore biking in the woods, but I like the comfort and ride of a mountain bike! These are easy "clamp-on" devices and they have an additional adjuster for the length to adjust for the height of the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Chase

customer_reviews.title: AVOID - Rubber Bushings Fail in less than 8 weeks
customer_reviews.text: This kickstand has been on my bicycle for less than 2 months and the rubber bushings have crumbled significantly, making it completely useless. The bike was not even exposed to extreme conditions (no rain, snow, etc). Those rubber bushings need to be redesigned with a more robust material. Until that is done this product is a waste of money. I would like my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Not that great.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced this with a Greenfield after a week on the trail. This may be a decent kickstand if you have no load on your bike. I bought it for a bike that was going to be used for a multi-day, multi-state touring ride (Pittsburgh to DC, GAP & C&O). This does not hold up under any kind of weight. It seems to be made OK, but simply doesn't work with a touring bike loaded with gear. I will only buy Greenfield rear mount (or if I can find them in stock, Trek) from now on. Again, it may work if you have a bike that is under no load whatsoever when parked.
customer_reviews.author: W. Jessup

customer_reviews.title: Kickstand looks quite sturdy, good quality
customer_reviews.text: The kickstand looks quite sturdy and , as other buyers have mentioned, it was very easy to install. I'm giving it 5 stars as I have just installed it today. If no revised critique later, it means I will hold that rating, if something changes, I will let you all know.
customer_reviews.author: John K. Maney

customer_reviews.title: You may have to modify this kickstand.
customer_reviews.text: The price was good but the stand had to be modified to fit my frame. It shows two rubber inserts mine only came with one. I still had to grind the mounting area to fit my frame then it worked. It’s ok not as sturdy as I had hoped for but adequate at best. Time will tell how sturdy it is.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Does not grip on small tube steel bikes
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these for my wife & my bikes. on her aluminum TREK with the wide diameter aluminum tubes, the kickstand works great was easy to install, stable no problem. On my steel Specialized the tube that the kickstand mounts to is a smaller diameter and the kickstand doesn't grip well and my bike ends up on the ground. I have tried shimming the tube with duct tape where the stand mounts but it still slips. Mine stand ended up in the recycle bin.
customer_reviews.author: CalBobCat

customer_reviews.title: A really good kick stand
customer_reviews.text: I'd never thought I'd ever praise a kick stand in my life! But this thing is really good. Easy to assemble. Tools included. I attached it to my daughters 24" hybrid bike and it is super easy for her to kick up an down. The spring loaded arm makes a huge difference. I am probably going to buy another one for my sons bike.
customer_reviews.author: Tony P

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Item came promptly, is well made. Easy attach, further back on the frame the better. Does allow for height adjustment which is significant. I recommend using blue lock tight to sustain solid hold. Otherwise all good. I recommend product and the seller.
customer_reviews.author: wmhadams2

customer_reviews.title: Needs to work on quality control
customer_reviews.text: It’s okay, so three stars of just okay. You would think when a company sold enough product, that quality control would become better. Nope, They sent me the worst looking one in there inventory. The finish is just the worst. The spring in the kick stand is so weak I sure hope it holds the bike up as time progress. This was the only kick stand that would work on my Aggressor GT Pro. I know because I tried them all.
customer_reviews.author: kevz71243Top Contributor: Kayaking

customer_reviews.title: Broke very quickly
customer_reviews.text: The item broke very quickly considering it simple application. From the attached images you can see although some of it is metal, the part the metal slides into is some sort of composite that didn't last. We purchased the kickstand at the end of last season and it broke quickly.
customer_reviews.author: HighExpectations

customer_reviews.title: It works but it breaks because its cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Had to buy another just to get parts to fix the first one. The bolt start loosening and then the bottom stand section drops off. Trying to tighten the bolt; it snaps in half because the bolt is garbage. If the bolt were more hardened, it could get 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Anon Y. Mous

customer_reviews.title: Very well built:  Powder coated
customer_reviews.text: GREAT: $6 !!! really, this would sell for much more at a bike shop - has hex inner wrench screws, three, needed to attach to the bike frame - the race for the frame is OVAL, but the rubber inserts, sturdy/substantial, on the inner race make round doable I guess, I have a DAHON Espresso and had an oval rear frame area. - POWDER coated !!! NICE. very well made, seams are tight all about. - only confusing thing, is the person whom assembled this at the factory mixed SAE and METRIC hex heads in same piece I had the ol HARBOR FREIGHT set of both keys on hand so not a problem, but you may need both.
customer_reviews.author: SonomaRik

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, perfect for my use.
customer_reviews.text: This thing does not come with an instruction, but the product page had illustrative instruction on how to install which is not difficult. I worried that the gap this thing was designed to put on might not fit my bike but turns out the bike frame size varies along that bar. You will easily find a place that could snap this on without hindering the pedal or anything else. Looks and feel sturdy. And it fits my white bike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs mods to work for me.
customer_reviews.text: 1st one lost the lower leg somewhere out in the back country. Bought another and used locktight on the holding screw. About 600 miles of single track riding and it is still good. Have had to make and glue in a spacer at the hinge so that my bike will stand more upright. Don't know how good other stands are but this will do and did not cost a fortune.
customer_reviews.author: Shorty

customer_reviews.title: Great so far.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good quality & like that it adjust in length. I was worried at first that it was not going to fit. I slid it toward the front like mots are located & the bolts hit the tire, slid back a little them bracket hit the pedal, slid back a little more & the foot hit my disc brakes. Finally slid half way back or so & it worked. Hold bike up great but does flex just a little but not enough to make it an issue.
customer_reviews.author: r jackson

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly BUT
customer_reviews.text: Installed it on my road bike but I had to put it as far back as the chain stay will allow. Any position further forward and my heel catches on the clamp. In retrospect, I probably would have opted for a bottom bracket kickstand instead.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Unstable kick stand
customer_reviews.text: Received product in “used” condition, but it’s a kickstand so I wasn’t that concern. Worked for a week then failed to hold my bike upright. Consequently, my bike fell and broke my mirror! 😡 I will be returning this Item promptly.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Z.

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly on 26" bike
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my bike since it didn't include a kickstand and its been doing the job. It isn't intrusive when pedaling and it was easy to assemble. It took me less than 3 minutes to get it on my bike properly. Give this product a chance. Also my mountain bike is a 26" and this fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Addicted2Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Strong and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: A stocky kickstand that certainly does the job ; it is adjustable ; it was easy to install; one drawback is that it is not a sleek kickstand- I had to adjust it further back than originally mounted because my rotating pedal smacked into it
customer_reviews.author: kkd

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job well
customer_reviews.text: Locally, there were 2 options for kick stands to purchase: adjustable with a screw & too short when done, or too long to start & adjustable with a hacksaw. This is a much better option. I also like having the kickstand further back on the bicycle. If you're worried about stripping the screw or having it loosen, I suggest using "Loctight" to keep the threading in place. Next I'm going to try one for my husband's bike. I'm hoping it will adjust long enough for his extra-tall bike frame.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: If your bike has a welded plate for a kickstand I recommend going with something like a greenfield because they are ...
customer_reviews.text: To be fair, this kickstand will be very serviceable to anyone that wants something cheap and strong. It is NOT however lightweight in any way. I wanted it to put on a hybrid commuter that gets parked at school with a kickstand. heavy 10.9 oz. If your bike has a welded plate for a kickstand I recommend going with something like a greenfield because they are 25% lighter and much less clunky. I returned.
customer_reviews.author: Easy E

customer_reviews.title: Installs easily, does exactly what it is supposed to do ...
customer_reviews.text: Installs easily, does exactly what it is supposed to do and I am a happy customer. The bulid is done well, it looks really elegant and appears as part of the bicycle , sturdy and stable. I highly recommend it as a replacement to the original that comes with the bicycle if it malfunctions, and they normally do after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Badran

customer_reviews.title: Weak metal
customer_reviews.text: Had trouble finding a place to put it. Wor ked loose on 2nd ride and broke on 3rd ride. I definitely do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Terry McKee

customer_reviews.title: ... put this on my Specialized Myka and am very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my Specialized Myka and am very happy with it. The quality is very high, especially for the price (this thing is solid). I didn't have any issues adjusting for length (I'm 5'5" and my bike is a 17) but was briefly concerned it wouldn't actually fit on my bike's frame. It took me a while to find the right position, where it wouldn't mess with the pedals or disc brake but could still be fastened to the bike. No complaints since I found the sweet spot!
customer_reviews.author: Ariz_Mountaineer

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kick stand based on reviews. My Gary Fisher mountain bike has a flattened bottom tube on the rear forks, so I didn't think I would have trouble getting this installed tightly - several reviews mentioned that it didn't work well with round tubes. In reality, it was looser than I wanted - it had some play to it. I could have lived with that, but what did me in is then the bolt for adjusting height of the stand sheared off while I was tightening it. I was using an Allen wrench, so it's not like I over torqued it with a drill driver. I am disappointed in this kickstand and do not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: ThomasTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, works well.
customer_reviews.text: My wife's bicycle actually came with a kickstand that didn't fit it! Well - it fit, but her pedal hit it every time it went around, making a loud clanking noise that drove her and everyone around a little nuts. That kickstand could not be adjusted. Her bicycle is white, so I bought one of these units in white for her bike. It works great, it looks great, and I can adjust it if I need to. Would definitely recommend this kickstand. Check the measurements on your frame - out bike was at the higher end of the measurements, so I was concerned about this fitting, but it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen L. Blythe

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This kickstand was very easy to install and works great. The spring action is nice, so it takes very little effort to raise and lower it. It installed easily on my mountain bike, and I could slide it around so it wouldn't interfere with the pedals. The only negative is that it came with absolutely zero paperwork. No diagram, directions, not even a link to the manufacturer's web site. Fortunately it is easy enough to install that it wasn't an issue, but I would expect at least a little slip of paper with a web site.
customer_reviews.author: JonMan72

customer_reviews.title: Waste of 20 bucks and took a whole month to get it
customer_reviews.text: Save your money. It was too big and too hard to put on my bike. I wasted 20 bucks....sitting in my tool drawer now. I waited also for a whole month looking forward to getting this and I was disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Diana-stay at home mom/retired teacher

customer_reviews.title: I don't recommend using kickstands that mount behind the crank shaft
customer_reviews.text: I see they have added pics with hole diameter sizing which would have been a big help when I ordered this for my daughter's 20 inch bike. It didn't work on her bike so bought another kick stand from a local shop. I ended up using the Top Cabin stand on my mountain bike instead. I don't recommend using kickstands that mount behind the crank shaft. Even on my mountain bike my heel hits the kickstand when pedaling every now and then.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but will not stay tight on '64 Raleigh Sport/Huffy Sportsman rebadge
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy but it will not stay tight on my bike with round and gradually tapered chain stays no matter what. I even checked the helpful dimension chart and even though their diameter is large enough, the clamp is best suited for larger oval and non-tapered chain stays. I will have to shop around for another one but selection is limited because the frame has no integrated side-stand mounting bracket.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore L. Wirth

customer_reviews.title: I would not buy again does not support bike well poor design
customer_reviews.text: Does not stay in place and does not support bike well. I would not purchase again
customer_reviews.author: beach bum

customer_reviews.title: Reliability, quality, and price. Really good for price.
customer_reviews.text: This item came on time and I am just getting into riding again after 20 years. I thought with new technologies now it would be much harder. But, it took me no more than 5 mins to install. Was very easy and pleased. Looks good too.
customer_reviews.author: RSP1017

customer_reviews.title: Had to Shorten It
customer_reviews.text: It folds in and out solidly. The construction is good and attaching it to the bike was easy. Make sure you have allen wrenches. I'm taking two stars off because I had to remove the extendable part with the foot on it and take off about 1" so that it was short enough for my son's 20" bmx bike. No big deal if you have a metal pipe saw. It is made of easy to saw aluminum.
customer_reviews.author: M. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Good, sturdy kickstand.
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that this stand can be moved along the rear side tube. It's sturdy enough for an old school steel frame mountain bike and I never have to worry about falling over.
customer_reviews.author: Dave, Boston

customer_reviews.title: Its all Good
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my E-bike. When backing the bike up the pedal would always hit the original kickstand and this solved my problem. It does feel weak on the spring when retracting and staying up so not sure how long this will last which is why 1 star was sacrificed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I put these on behind the disk brake and adjusted it all the way down and it works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I got these to fit bikes the bike shop said they did not make bike stands for. My 29 inch Treks did not have stands and the Trek store there were none made for them. I put these on behind the disk brake and adjusted it all the way down and it works like a charm. I have jumped, slammed, fell, and the stand has never dropped by accident. And it holds the bike solid as a rock, I will buy again if I need it for another bike.
customer_reviews.author: Always Buying Something

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to put on the bike.  A very functional kickstand for my mountain bike.
customer_reviews.text: This kickstand involved a simple 5 minute process to put on my mountain bike and it works fine. I was growing tired of leaning my bike against walls and fences or laying it on its side. This is a nice remedy and the kickstand is out of the way past my pedals. It doesn't seem to rattle and is well constructed. I'm not rock-hopping or bike racing so the convenience of a kickstand certainly outweighs any sliver of extra weight. It might be nice if they included a modest wrench for the installation, but I had a set of handy hex wrenches.
customer_reviews.author: kcotulla

customer_reviews.title: Still looking for a good aftermarket kickstand
customer_reviews.text: I've had a hard time finding an aftermarket kickstand for my bike. This one is solid and adjustable, but the way it attaches to the frame doesn't work well in my case. After tightening the screws about as tight as I could, the kickstand still has a tendency to slide out. The problem is that the oval clamp doesn't attach solidly to the round frame. Also, it attaches farther to the rear of the bike than standard kickstands so even if the kickstand doesn't slide out, it still isn't very stable. Long story short, I'm still looking for a good aftermarket kickstand.
customer_reviews.author: JJ Boomer

customer_reviews.title: Not Durable
customer_reviews.text: Three strikes you're out Like them but they do not last the bottom piece breaks off- happened to the third one that I bought each will last under a year
customer_reviews.author: TBTF

customer_reviews.title: ... stand I got this one and it is the best kick stand I have ever had stand the bike ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my old Raleigh tangent it didn't have a spot to bolt a normal kick stand I got this one and it is the best kick stand I have ever had stand the bike almost straight up so the front wheel doesn't turn and every kick stand I have had when that happens majority of the time it falls over. Great design
customer_reviews.author: justin davis

customer_reviews.title: Looks and works great
customer_reviews.text: Looks and works great. I was puzzled at first because there are no instructions but that may be because it's easy to figure out. My 12 year-old daughter installed it herself on her brand new bike but couldn't figure it out on her own at first. That said, it fits and works so well that we don't even think about it, which is the way it should be. The colors just happen to match her bike so it just seems like it came with it. We put it on a Diamondback Tess 24.
customer_reviews.author: Frank from Maryland

customer_reviews.title: Great kick stand for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little kick stand. I installed it on my 2016 Diamondback Insight II, and it looks awesome. We'll see how it handles some wear, so I'll come back later to weigh in durability some time down the road. Update: After 100 plus miles of riding, the stand is holding up really good. I actually bought another one for my daughter's bike too. :)
customer_reviews.author: mathgeek669

customer_reviews.title: Easy install but not very stable
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install but not very stable. I purchased these for my own bike and my husbands and they have required repeated tightening to stand up right, every few weeks I have to pull out an Allen wrench and adjust them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for 24" bike... But very stable kickstand!!
customer_reviews.text: The kickstand is too long for a 24" bicycle. My husband used his hacksaw and whacked a piece of the stem off. Perfect!! Love the extra wide rubber foot!!
customer_reviews.author: beth

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy stand, looks good too!
customer_reviews.text: Got a new GT Aggressor for my teeanager and bought this stand since we needed something that was not center mount. First we took it to Dick's Sporting Goods where the bike was being assembled and without even opening it they told us that it wouldn't work..... but we came home and installed it ourselves. It was easy to install and in my opinion it fits perfectly and it looks good and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, & will probably break if accidently put under load.
customer_reviews.text: Heavier than I'd like. Smells of machine/mineral oil really strongly might get on your hands no big deal. Adjustable extension arm is definitely a design asking to break under load. I've only just installed it but it seems like it will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Doug bob

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit well without some modifications
customer_reviews.text: After screwing the pieced together as tight as possible, the kickstand still slips on the frame. I ended up wrapping the frame with some sport tape to give it more to hold onto, and that seems to have worked, but I wouldn't buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: ThatOneGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great kickstand
customer_reviews.text: works as intended, no issues, just make sure you re-tighten it after it's been on a day or so, the rubber pads slowly compress leaving it loose on the bike
customer_reviews.author: Speedpro81

customer_reviews.title: Great value but one small flaw
customer_reviews.text: Idk what to do to fix it but it does slip and come loose over a short time. It tends to move no matter how tight I make it :/ But over all, it's a nice kickstand for a bike that doesn't come with one.
customer_reviews.author: CloudE Solutions

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: My new to me bike did not come with a kickstand and I don't like trying to prop it up somewhere in our garage. This was a simple 5 minute job to assemble and works perfectly. Would recommend for anyone needing to add this to their bike.
customer_reviews.author: C. Tate

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 27.5 Medium Specialized Rockhopper
customer_reviews.text: I had origionally purchased the center mount kickstand made by Specialized for my 27.5 Medium Specialized Rockhopper but it pressed against my tire hard, clearly not compatable engienring. This kickstand was the perfect solution! I love how its adjustable both in length and placement on the bike frame. I definatly would reccomend this kickstand especially if you have a Specialized brand bike or Center mount kickstands arent working for you.
customer_reviews.author: Katie s.

customer_reviews.title: Too Short
customer_reviews.text: I have a 26" mountain bike and this was too short, even when extended the full length. It says it will accommodate bikes to 28", but I don't see how. Also, the spring action is weak and it flops around a little when folded up.
customer_reviews.author: Davido

customer_reviews.title: works well, well made
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and comes with the allen wrenches. Seems well-made and is working well for a mtn bike with a low, rectangular chain stay.
customer_reviews.author: Ken S

customer_reviews.title: a well made, good quality kickstand
customer_reviews.text: It is a well made, good quality kickstand. It is easily to put on and it fits well if the “chain-stay” has an oval shape with a circumference at 2 3⁄4” plus minus 1/8”. My speed-bike’s chain-stay circumference is a little smaller than that but I successfully put it on after wrapping the chain-stay with some docking tape to increase the circumference. BTW, it your bike's chain-stay is too small and you try to wrap lots of docking tape that will not work, because the clamp will not have enough bite to hold the kickstand in a fixed position.
customer_reviews.author: Steven W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Kickstand for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install, very impressed with how strong it is, and how well it works. Adjusts easily, and stays there. We are Very happy with this kickstand!
customer_reviews.author: Dave O

customer_reviews.title: Other than that it took only few mins to get this installed and super easy not much tools required
customer_reviews.text: I could not give 5 starts mostly not manufacturers fault nor the products faults it is because of Amazon bcos it brings up this stand when I search for 18 inch bike stand. This is probably 1 inch longer than needed, I had to get it cut once I do that I am hoping this would solve the kickstand issue on my sons bike. Other than that it took only few mins to get this installed and super easy not much tools required. Remember if you are buying this for a 18 inch bike you should be prepared to cut an inch out.
customer_reviews.author: LAKS

customer_reviews.title: This thing holds up.  I am ordering 2 more today.
customer_reviews.text: Hey, I ordered my first on June 18 and my second and third a few minutes after I installed the first. I installed this kickstand in about 3 minutes. There are anti-scratch pads integrated into the kickstand. I appreciate that. This is a $1500 bike I am building and the powder coating was nearly $400. The bike this kickstand is holding weighs nearly 50lbs and lot of that weight is in the rear. The kickstand tucks nicely away. Thankfully, this adjustable kickstand solved my issue we'll. it even come with a rubber foot so it won't scratch your nice floors. Enjoy. joe
customer_reviews.author: Gig Mata

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work very well because if you can install at all, it must be installed so far over on the bar to avoid the pedal, that the bike doesn't stand up.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Andrews

customer_reviews.title: It is ok
customer_reviews.text: It works. Flimsyer than I had hoped for. It is working. I just dont know how long it will last. I forsee a replacement being needed.
customer_reviews.author: K Johnston

product_meta.title: TOPCABIN Bike Kickstand Adjustable Aluminium Alloy Bicycle Kickstand Bike Side Kickstand Fit for 22" 24" 26" 28" Mountain Bike/700 Road Bike/BMX/MTB
product_meta.description:
Note: This kickstand is not suitable for 20 inch bike, please pay attention to it before you buy!


It is suitable for mountain, road bike, folding bike-fixed all tubes!

It makes your bicycle convenient to parking

Waterproof and wear-resisting, durable to use

Made of aluminum alloy material, with top quality and very strong

Fit for 22" 24" 26" 28" tire and 700 road bicycle
Package Contents: bike kickstand * 1, rubber mat * 1 pair, wrench * 2
feature_bullets: Suitable: This bike kickstand fits for 22" 24" 26" 28" Mountain Bike/700 Road Bike/BMX/MTB
It makes your bicycle convenient to parking. Package Contents: bike kickstand * 1, rubber mat * 1 pair, wrench * 2
Length adjustable: This bike kickstand with wrench to loosen the middle of screw, length can be adjustable between 12.2”-14.2”(310-360mm). Fits on oval tube diameter 15-28 mm.
Made of aluminum alloy material, with top quality and very strong,Waterproof Anti-rust and wear-resisting, durable to use
12-month warranty, customer satisfaction guarantee and 24/7 customer support.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
